prompt: You are in check. You can capture, block, or run. Choose the best defense.
coachOnSuccess: Good. When you can safely remove the attacker, that is usually best.

prompt: Double check! Two pieces are attacking your King at once. Remember: you cannot block them both and you cannot capture them both. Find the only defense.
coachOnSuccess: Exactly. In a double check, the King must move.

prompt: The King is trapped behind his pawns on the back rank. Deliver checkmate in one move.
coachOnSuccess: His own soldiers became his prison walls.

prompt: Your Queen and Bishop work together. Place the Queen next to the King so that she is protected and it is checkmate.

prompt: You can give many checks here, but only one move is checkmate. Find it.
coachOnSuccess: Excellent. Do not play hope checks—play the move that kills.

prompt: You are completely winning. One move is stalemate, one move is checkmate. Find the move that wins the game.
coachOnSuccess: Good. Mercy is kind in life, but fatal in chess.

prompt: You are losing badly. There is no way to win—but there is a stalemate trick. Find the move that forces stalemate.
